info.title: User Options API
info.description:
The API enables you to perform all the actions allowed in the User Options. You can use this REST API to add, change, copy, delete or execute the user option definition.

The user option function enables you to select and maintain user-defined options. If you are a TD/OMS manager, you are able to define global and private user options. As a non-manager, you can define your own user options which can be promoted to global user options by the TD/OMS manager.

port.description: The port to which the server is listening.

/add.description: Use this path to add the user option.

post.summary: Use this operation to add the user option.
post.description: Use this operation to add the user option.

requestBody.description: Use this input to add the user option.

addRequest.summary: How to specify the add request input parameters value.

addResponse200.summary: Response to a successful API call.

message.messageText: Action *ADD for user options completed normally. &N Cause . . . . . :   Your request for action *ADD for user options completed normally. &N Recovery  . . . :   None needed, this message is informational.

/execute.summary: Use this path to execute the user option.
/execute.description: Use this path to execute the user option.

post.description: Use this operation to execute the user option.

executeResponse200.summary: Response to a successful API call.

message.messageText: The user option xx executed successfully. &N Cause . . . . . :   You tried to execute the user option xx, which was executed successfully. &N Recovery  . . . :   None needed. This message is informational.

messageType.description: The message type 'E' indicates an error message,  while 'N' indicates a normal message with no error.

status.description: The return status can be *NORM or *TERM. In the case of *TERM look at the messages for more information.

errorResponse.description: This will return the error information.

addRequest.description: Request data to add the user option.

changeRequest.description: Request data to change the user option definition.

copyRequest.description: Request data to copy the user option definition to another user option.

deleteRequest.description: Request data to delete the user option definition.

deleteProcessingOptions.description: Various flags to control the behavior of the API.

response.description: This will return the response data.

ignoreWarnings.description:
Specify the ignore warnings indicator. The possible values are:    
                                                                 
*NO                                                              
Use this value if you want to show warning messages.         
                                                                 
*YES                                                             
Use this value if you do not want to show warning messages.

updateDb.description: Specify '1' to update the database or '0' to not update but check only.

updateBuffer.description: Specify '1' to update the returned data with the latest values or '0' to not return the latest data.

toUserIDOrUserClass.description:
Specify the user id or user class for the global or private user option.
The possible values are:      
                                                                        
*SAME     
Use this value to indicate that the user does not change if you are in change mode. In copy mode, the current user profile will be used.
                                                                        
*ALL      
Use this value to define the global user option.                    
                                                                        
   Note:   
   Only the TD/OMS manager is allowed to define a global user option.

interfaceLevel.description: The interface level must be V17R1M0.

addProcessingOptions.description: Various flags to control the behavior of the API.

changeProcessingOptions.description: Various flags to control the behavior of the API.

userOptionDescription.description:
Specify the user option description.     
                                                        
*SAME     
Use this value to indicate that the description does not change if you are in change or copy mode. It is not allowed in add mode.

actionGroupCode.description:
The Action Group code can be used to group user options in logical groups. These groups will manifest themselves as submenu's in the GUI.   
                                                                       
*SAME            
Use this value to indicate that the action group does not change if you are in change or copy mode, in add mode, it contains a blank value.

authorisationCode2.description:
This is the authorization level required to execute the user option. Authorization code '*DISABLED' indicates that the user option is disabled. The possible values are:                            
                                                                       
*SAME                      
Use this value to indicate that the authorization code does not change if you are in change or copy mode, in add mode, it contains the default value. The default value for the authorization code is *ADMIN.                                                          
                                                                       
*USER                                                                  
Use this value to indicate that the user option is enabled for the user.                                                              
                                                                       
*PGMR     
Use this value to indicate that the user option is enabled for the programmer.    

*ADMIN     
Use this value to indicate that the user option is enabled for the admin.     
                                                                      
*DISABLED    
Use this value to indicate that the user option is disabled.

checkEntry.description:
This field indicates if TD/OMS should check if the user is authorized for the selected entry. This field should be set to *NO if the user option is not related to a particular entry. The user option CW (Command line in a window) is an example of such an option. The possible values are:      
                                                                        
*SAME       
Use this value to indicate that the check entry does not change if you are in change or copy mode, in add mode, it contains the default value. The default for the check entry is *YES.     
                                                                        
*NO     
Use this value to indicate that the user option is not related to the particular entry.    

*YES     
Use this value to indicate that the user option is related to the particular entry.

entityCode.description:
The entity code is used to identify the entity for which a user option can be used. Combinations can be made by adding the numbers.           
                                                                       
  *REQUEST    - Request                                                                          
  *TASK           - Task                                                  
  *SOLUTION  - Solution                                              
  *OBJECT       - Object                                                
                                                                       
    Note:    
    If the entity code is '03' then the user option is available for both Request and Task.                                         
                                                                       
*SAME                
Use this value to indicate that the entity code does not change if you are in change or copy mode, in add mode it contains the default value. the default value for the entity code is *TASK.

whereToActivateIndicator.description:
Specifies where this user has to be activated.     
                                                                      
*SAME                                                                 
Use this value to indicate that the where to activate does not change if you are in change or copy mode, in add mode it contains the default value. the default value for the where to activate is *SERVER.      
                                                                      
*CLIENT      
 Runs the option in the TD/OMS GUI.                                
                                                                      
*SERVER     
Runs the option on the Server which currently is the IBM i.

passParametersIndicator.description:
This element specifies whether or not parameters are passed to the calling program. The possible values are:                               
                                                                        
*NO                                                             
No parameters are passed to the calling program.                    
                                                                        
*YES                                                            
Parameters are passed to the calling program.                       
                                                                        
*SAME                                                                   
Use this value to indicate that the Pass parameters does not change if you are in change or copy mode, in add mode it contains the default value. the default value for the Pass parameters is *YES.

programName.description:
Contains the name of the program that is called when the indicated user option is used. Please keep in mind that the program you are using may not adopt authority from the calling program. Otherwise, the program would adopt TD/OMS authority because all TD/OMS functions are owned by the user OMS (including the database).                                  
                                                                        
A correct user option program may not adopt authority. This can be achieved by using the CHGPGM command and use the USEADPAUT(*NO) keyword and value. It is possible to run under the profile of the owner of the program.                                                                
                                                                        
If user option programs are called with parameters they will receive information about the entity used.  Information about the parameters can be retrieved by looking at source member OMUSROPTGE in your QUSRSRC source file.    

*SAME             
Use this value to indicate that the program name does not change if you are in change or copy mode, in add mode it contains the blank value.

programLibrary.description:
Contains the name of the library where the user option program can be found.                                    
                                                         
*SAME                                                    
Use this value to indicate that the program library does not change if you are in change or copy mode, in add mode it contains the blank value.

commandString.description:
Specify the command string.   

*SAME                                                    
Use this value to indicate that the command string does not change if you are in change or copy mode, in add mode it contains the blank value.

copyProcessingOptions.description: Various flags to control the behavior of the API.

userIDOrUserClass.description:
Specify the user id or user class for the global or private user option.
The possible values are:      
                                                                        
*ALL       
Use this value to define the global user option.                    
                                                                        
Note:   
Only the TD/OMS manager is allowed to define a global user option.                                                    
                                                                        
*CURRENT                                                                
 Use this value to define a private user option it will use your current user profile.

whereVisibleIndicator.description:
The Where Visible indicator is used to specify where the entry is visible.                                                 
                                                                        
*SAME                                                                   
Use this value to indicate that the where visible does not change if you are in change or copy mode, in add mode it contains the default value. the default value for the where visible is *BOTH.          
                                                                        
*CLIENT                                                                 
The option is only visible on the client.                           
                                                                        
*SERVER                                                                 
The option is only visible on the server.                           
                                                                        
*BOTH       
The option is visible on both the client and the server.

entityCode.description:
The entity code is used to identify the entity for which a user option can be used. Combinations can be made by adding the numbers.           
                                                                       
  *REQUEST    - Request                                                                          
  *TASK           - Task                                                  
  *SOLUTION  - Solution                                              
  *OBJECT       - Object                                                
                                                                       
    Note:    
    If the entity code is '03' then the user option is available for both Request and Task.

executeRequest.description: Request data to execute the user option.

executeResponse.description: Returns the response when user option is executed.

taskKey.description:
The task information to execute the user option at the task lavel.   

Note:     
If you specify the task key information, the request key, solution key, and object key information will be ignored because the user option will be executed at the task level.

requestKey.description:
The request information to execute the user option at the request lavel.  

Note:     
If you specify the request key information, the task key, solution key, and object key information will be ignored because the user option will be executed at the request level.

solutionKey.description:
The solution information to execute the user option at the solution lavel.   

Note:     
If you specify the solution key information, the request key, task key, and object key information will be ignored because the user option will be executed at the solution level.

objectKey.description:
The object information to execute the user option at the object lavel.  

Note:     
If you specify the object key information, the task key, request key, and solution key information will be ignored because the user option will be executed at the object level.

checkProcessingInd.description: Specify '2' to process the user option or '1' to not process but check only.

executeProcessingOption.description: The flags to control the behavior of the execute user option program.

messages.messageText: User option must contain at least one alphabetical character. &N Cause . . . . . :   You did not enter an alphabetical character in the user option field. This is not allowed. The user option must at least contain 1 character in the 'A' - 'Z' range. &N Recovery  . . . :   Change the user option and try your request again.

value.messageText: Unauthorized or expired token. Please login again.

executeRequestLevel.summary: How to specify the execute request input parameters value at the request level.

executeTaskLavel.summary: How to specify the execute request input parameters value at the task level.

executeSolutionLevel.summary: How to specify the execute request input parameters value at the solution level.

executeObjectLevel.summary: How to specify the execute request input parameters value at the object level.
